body_html:
I think BCELoss has always required a float or double tensor for its input: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html?highlight=bceloss#torch.nn.BCELoss (you can change the version number and the docs look the same).

Are you thinking of CrossEntropyLoss? That one takes LongTensors for target

body:
I think BCELoss has always required a float or double tensor for its input: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html?highlight=bceloss#torch.nn.BCELoss (you can change the version number and the docs look the same).

Are you thinking of CrossEntropyLoss? That one takes LongTensors for target
